alert.note: Alert for Berkshire; Franklin (Massachusetts) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued July 10 at 4:07PM EDT until July 11 at 2:16AM EDT by NWS Boston
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Massachusetts... Deerfield At Charlemont affecting Franklin and Berkshire Counties. For the Deerfield River...including Charlemont...Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL JUST AFTER MIDNIGHT TONIGHT... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Deerfield at Charlemont. * WHEN...Until just after midnight tonight. * IMPACTS...At 12.5 feet, In Charlemont and Buckland, floodwaters inundate low lying farmland adjacent to the Deerfield River, and encroach on lowest lying structures near the River near West Hawley Road and Route 2. Floodwaters inundate the lowest lying roadway in the Mohawk Park Campground, and encroach on lowest lying structure off of Zoar Road, Route 2 and West Hawley Road. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 3:30 PM EDT Monday the stage was 11.6 feet. - Bankfull stage is 12.0 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 3:30 PM EDT Monday was 11.6 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest of 12.3 feet this evening. It will then fall below flood stage just after midnight tonight. - Flood stage is 10.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 12.3 feet on 03/28/1919. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued late tonight at 230 AM EDT.
